page.title: 06OVINGTON
page.content: {Ovington }is a tiny village about two miles from Belchamp St.Paul. There are now only 55 people living there whereas, before the{Second World {War,}1939-1945, there were more than 300. Twelve houses and a whole farm,{'Hole Farm',}were demolished so that Ridgewell airfield could be built for the war effort. Those houses have never been rebuilt. Another reason for the{drop in population}is the change in agriculture. Where it used to take 16 men to work on a 400 acre farm now, just 2 men can do the work. People move away from the village to work in the towns. So houses become empty and are demolished. There is no shop in Ovington, people go to Clare, Haverhill and Sudbury. There was a public house in Ovington called{The {Donkey,}but it closed down over 20 years ago.
